availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Bruner Snider (Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Snider, Jr. and Mary Newton Snider. Married to Lucy T. Miller Snider in Hancock County, Kentucky, on November 17, 1847. Father of David E. Snider, John R. Snider, Mary C. Snider, Sallie Snider, Emily Snider, Benjamin Snider, and William Snider. Farmer in Hancock County in 1850. Farmer in Hancock County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 301A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 1017.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 161A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Hancock County, KY, July and August 1863, p. 20.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, Film #000495729.
Oswald Jett, Hancock County, Kentucky - Volume 2: Pioneer Paths Widen, (Utica, KY: 1989), 182.
